results.title: URSA Mini Pro 4.6K G2 Form Prototype
results.credit_line: Courtesy Blackmagic Design, Major Partner of ACMI
results.brief_description: This prototype was built using a combination of stereolithography (SLA) and full colour 3D printed parts, which were made from a powdered material solidified by an inkjet printing process over hundreds of layers. It was used by the Blackmagic Industrial Design team during the early stages of design process to evaluate the camera’s design and functionality.

results.title: URSA Mini Pro 4.6K G2
results.credit_line: Courtesy Blackmagic Design, Major Partner of ACMI
results.brief_description: Around 2015, Emmy Award-winning filmmaker Jody Eldred tested a pre-production model of the BlackMagic URSA Mini 4.6K in the Las Vegas desert. Aside from his 40-year career in film and TV, Eldred had spent 15 years testing cameras. “Wow,” was his response to the camera’s quality, but he had a few suggestions for on how to improve it. Less than a year later the URSA Mini Pro 4.6k was released with those changes implemented. “I was stunned,” Eldred has said. He hadn’t encountered a camera company that listening to the people who use them.

results.title: URSA Mini Pro 4.6K G2
results.credit_line: Courtesy Blackmagic Design, Major Partner of ACMI
results.brief_description:
URSA Mini Pro is a professional digital film camera that combines high resolution
image quality with the features and controls of a traditional broadcast camera.
A highly versatile camera format, it’s been used in the creation of a number of
Hollywood productions, television and streaming series as well as studio and
live production events.

results.title: Urinary incontinence: a personal disaster (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Guy Fergusson and Royal Society of Medicine Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Discusses the causes of incontinence and methods of treatment. Endeavours to isolate specific causes and direct the treatment to that cause.
Suitable for medical students and staff.

results.title: Urbanissimo
results.brief_description: This film is a colourful statement on the destruction of nature, city planning, aimless construction and rebuilding, pollution and the revamping of natural life styles that comes with a mechanised society. Modern jazz music and subtle sound effects are used in this entertaining film. This film was included as the finale in the main pavilion of Expo ‘67 in Canada and later screened at the 43rd San Francisco International Film Festival, April 20-May 4, 2000.

results.title: Urban sprawl
results.brief_description: Shows the characteristic pattern of recent urban growth throughout the United States. Discusses the problems created by urban sprawl, explains the necessity for planning future development, and describes the factors that must be considered to make the best use of land space and to meet the total needs of people.

results.title: Urban sprawl
results.creator_credit: Stuart Finley and Stuart Finley Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how new techniques of planning can promote orderly growth and development, thereby counteracting the natural tendency of urban sprawl which ultimately creates blighted communities. Includes scenes of the upper East Branch of Brandywine Creek near Philadelphia.

results.title: Urban scrawl
results.brief_description: This vibrant documentary leads its audience to a more sophisticated understanding of the controversial artistic subculture of street art. Well controlled production values allow the reasoned arguments of those involved to be developed in a manner that is both thought provoking and educative.

holdings.name: MPEG-2 Digital File; Memory Grid Pod Full Encode

results.title: Urban poetics
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
An abstract visual narrative about 21st century modern living and the absurdity of life. Themes of urban sprawl, desolation, commercialism and the mundanity of routine and the ordinary are all explored in this short film.
